text.0: your men have followed indra for his friendship and for his lovingkindness glorified him.
text.1: for he bestows great wealth the thunderwielder worship him great and kind to win his favour.
text.2: him to whose hand men closely cling and drivers stand on his golden chariot firmly stationed.
text.3: with his firm arms he holds the reins his horses the stallions are yoked ready for the journey.
text.4: thy devotees embrace thy feet for glory bold thunderarmed rich through thy strength in guerdon.
text.5: robed in a garment fair as heaven to look on thou hast displayed thee like an active dancer.
text.6: that soma when effused hath best consistence for which the food is dressed and grain is mingled.
text.7: by which the men who pray extolling indra chief favourites of gods recite their praises.
text.8: no limit of thy might hath been appointed which by its greatness sundered earth and heaven.
text.9: these the prince filleth full with strong endeavour driving as twere with help his flocks to waters.
text.10: so be the lofty indra prompt to listen helper unaided goldenvisored hero.
text.11: yea so may he shown forth in might unequalled smite down the many vṛtras and the dasyus.
